ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Rejoice all ye Hybrids
ygData.msgSnippet: Whoa...easy there.  Heh...the guy just caught something out of context, or misread it, and thought the worst for a moment.  It s great you wanna help set him
ygData.messageBody:
Whoa...easy there. Heh...the guy just caught something out of context, or
misread it, and thought the worst for a moment. It's great you wanna help
set him straight, but lets not turn this into the everquest.com message
boards.

It's ok to cut people a little slack. :)

At

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeffrey Sue [mailto:jsue@...]
Sent: Monday, January 15, 2001 12:55 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Rejoice all ye Hybrids


At 09:56 PM 1/14/01 -0800, delbozz wrote:

>----- Original Message -----
>From: "Sean Kennedy" <ksean2@...>
>To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
>Sent: Sunday, January 14, 2001 7:51 PM
>Subject: [eqbards] Rejoice all ye Hybrids
>
>
> > For details on the removal of the hybrid exp penalty
> > (sort of) look at http://eq.castersrealm.com
> >
>
> Lest we forget that verant has stated bards are not hybrids.....
>also look at this I clipped from the post
>
>This is a balance issue we decided was also necessary to address. If we are
>going to make the statement that class experience penalties should not
>exist, we then have to do it on both ends (with exception to the two
classes
>that we've decided to leave as-is).
>
>How much you wanna bet that bards will be one of the "as-is" classes.

I will take any and all action on this bet. The discussion was in regard to
CLASS exp
penalty, not HYBRID exp penalty. It was STATED that rogues and warriors had
an
experience BONUS, and they are leaving these 2 classes as is.

try and take things in context before whining and complaining.




Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
